111111222.content:
"Ugh," Ahsoka said, rubbing her stomach. "Why'm I so hungry all of a sudden?"

"Do not be concerned," said the butter-smooth voice, "hunger is only a temporary condition, Darth Phegia."

"Don't call me that!" Ahsoka screamed, knocking the holocron across the room with a furious blast of Force. "I am not a Sith!" I'm not like him -- I could never do what he did! And yet dozens of memories came flooding back to her -- every time she'd been disciplined for being brash and impulsive, for letting her emotions rule her. She remembered being scolded by Anakin once for ignoring orders, only to have Obi-Wan to comment wryly that she was learning more from her master than he perhaps meant to teach. She'd always been proud to have the same independent streak as Anakin -- to be like him in so many ways --

Did that mean that somewhere, deep down inside her, was a Sith? A traitor? A merciless killer?

"Of course. Forgive me.... Ahsoka," the voice in her head whispered. "But you must eat. And you will find little to appeal to you on this world."

I shouldn't do what it says, Ahsoka thought. On the other hand, it was telling her to eat. She could hardly refuse to ever eat again! And she was ravenous...

She knew she should leave the holocron here, but -- well, it wouldn't do for someone unwary to stumble across it, would it? She scooped it up and carried it to her waiting ship. When she opened up the storage locker, she found a nasty surprise inside.

"Master An -- I -- I mean -- Anakin -- " she stammered, before she realized the specter in front of her wasn't a Force ghost at all, but merely a recorded hologram.

"Hey, Snips. Sorry I was too busy to see you off. I'm going to ask one of the droids to slip this into your locker so I can wish you luck. Hope you manage to find that thing." The blue image of Anakin grinned. "Bring me back a souvenir, would ya? A real authentic ... well, I guess all they have is rocks, huh?"

The features distorted as Ahsoka grabbed the hologram generator. She felt hot blood pulsing in her temples and along her lekku, and pain in her throat. She didn't know whether she wanted to lay her head against his shoulder and weep or drive her lightsaber through his heart. Had you already decided to betray us when you recorded this? Or hadn't you made up your mind yet?

She crushed the little generator in her first, feeling the tiny components crumble through her fingers. Something deep inside her told her this was wrong, that letting rage roll over her like this was exactly what she shouldn't be doing... but she was so angry. Angry ...and horribly, gnawingly hungry. Her stomach felt like it was eating itself alive.

I just need something to eat, she thought, rubbing tears from her eyes, just a little something and-- and then I'll be able to think clearly.

"That's right," said a little voice in the back of her head, almost too softly for her to hear. "All you need is a little snack..."
111111222.title: Ahsoka's Rage

1111112221.content:
Ahsoka sat in the booth, chewing the greasy Biscuit Baron food mechanically as she listened to the holonet broadcast emanating from the battered old transmitter. When she'd first entered the restaurant, cloak drawn tightly around herself, the breathlessly repeated rumor had been that Anakin was dead, cut down in single combat with Obi-Wan. Hearing that had twisted Ahsoka's stomach into knots as grim satisfaction warred with grief.

It wasn't true, however -- not if you could trust the holonet news, which was reporting now that "Lord Vader" had survived the "cowardly murder attempt". Apparently the press knew which way the wind was blowing. The names of the dead Jedi were reported as if they were criminals cut down fleeing the scene of the crime. Master Luminara, dead. Master Plo, dead. Master Windu, dead. Master Yoda -- reported dead, but no body had yet been recovered.

Meaning they didn't get him, Ahsoka thought when she heard that. At least there was one bright spot in the litany of horrors.

She shifted in her seat. In the grip of misery and that strange, all-consuming hunger, she'd gorged herself on a mountain of junk. Now that the cravings had receded, she felt bloated and sluggish. Not good. She was a fugitive, now, after all; what if she had to defend herself? Right now she didn't even think she could move, she was so heavily distended with gravy and starch.

No one knows where you are, the voice said. Eat your fill!

But Ahsoka had had more than her fill already, and the thought of more made her want to throw up. What had possessed her to eat like this? It was so... undisciplined. Not the Jedi way at all.

I guess I'd better learn the non-Jedi way to do things, hadn't I? she thought miserably. She'd never been so alone in her life.

"You're not alone," said the little voice. "You've got me."
1111112221.title: Biscuit Baron Booth Binge

Arriving on Nar Shadaa, Ahsoka grabs a bite to eat
11111122211.content:
The Republic was dead. The Empire lived. Chancellor Palpatine had granted himself supreme power, power allowed by a corrupt senate of incompetent politicians.The Jedi Order had been eradicated, few had survived the culling. The few that did were being hunted like animals across the galaxy. Ahsoka knew she was in grave danger, that every moment she spent in Republic space could be her last. The voice seemed to disagree.

"Why do you worry for your life child? You slipped through the cracks, the Empire cares not for! Live the life you have been so graciously granted, enjoy it for what it's worth. This meal is delicious is it not? You should have some more." said the voice in her head..

*Urp* "Ugh...no more." Ahsoka thought, the cramping in her stomach worsened at the mere thought of another bite. "I can't just sit here and gorge myself like this, I'm not safe. All it would take is one Clone Trooper to recognize me for it all to end. Why can't you understand that?"

The voice was silent. Ahsoka liked to think it was because she had a point.

"And what of the survivors? There has to be a few, the Jedi are too tenacious to just be taken out like this! I'm one of the last of the Order, it's my duty to come to their aid."

"And yet if they do survive, they seem not to care for you?" The voice finally replied. "The Order is full of selfish fools, and narcissistic hypocrites. They care only for their own lives Dar-I mean Ahsoka. They created the Order to give themselves a fixed amount of power over the Galaxy. Even to the very end they were concerned with holding onto as much power as they could muster. Even to the very end they fought for the sake of a corrupt ruler, if only because that was the easiest way of continuing their own existence. "

"You're wrong! The Order has helped billions across the galaxy, we are selfless in our actions! I know what you are, a scheming Sith, trying to turn me from the Jedi path. You hold no sway with me, I will seek out the remaining members of the Order, and we will combat this evil that has swept the galaxy. No matter how much you want me to just sit back and stuff myself."

Ahsoka contemplated where to go next. It was obvious that she needed to leave Republic space as soon as she could, but where? Ahsoka weighed her options. Tattooine was far outside of Republic control, but the memories of Anakin were tied heavily to that scorched rock. She had heard tales of Jedi Adepts who had long left the order, making their home in the Shadowlands of the wookie homeworld Kashyyyk, but recent radio chatter had spoken heavily of a war being raged between Empire Clone Troopers and the Wookie natives, she would be putting herself into too much danger to seek out Jedi who might not even be there.

"...Nar Shadaa! Eureka!" Ahsoka said aloud, attracting the attention of the diner's patrons. "Uh...ignore that everybody."

Nar Shadaa was perfect, a sprawling metropolis of low-lives and thugs, a planet entirely out of the Empire's control and directly under that of the Hutt syndicate. The Hutts never tolerated Republic interference and it had managed to stay entirely out of the Galactic War because of it. It was the perfect place to lose yourself in, to become another faceless entity in the crowd. Even the most skilled force adept would find it near impossible to pick out a Force User in the sea of bodies. The perfect place for a Jedi to hide themselves, and the perfect place for a Jedi to be found.

"Ah. Nar Shadaa" the voice said perking up, " I see we are on the same page then. Hutt planets are known for their delicious and fattening foods afterall."

"Still not listening to you!" Ahsoka thought intently.
11111122211.title: Ahsoka begins seeking out other survivors.

111111222111.content:
Cloak wrapped tightly around herself, Ahsoka navigated the refuse-strewn walkways of the Corellian Sector. Her thoughts kept drifting to everything and everyone she'd lost, but she forced herself to be vigilant. A lone girl on Nar Shaddaa could be a tempting targets for thugs, thieves, and worse. Not that she had much to fear from garden-variety lowlives; in fact, she almost hoped someone did try something. She could use the exercise. After all that time in the pilot's chair, she felt soft. Sloppy. She knew it was mostly her imagination, but she wanted to keep it that way.

Ahead of her shone the bright incandescent lights of the Meltdown Cafe, which a few subtle inquiries had indicated was the best place to find a bounty hunter.

"And a bite to eat," the voice suggested. Ahsoka frowned.

"No food. I'll need every credit to hire someone decent." The former Padawan was well aware that a bounty hunter capable of tracking down a Jedi in hiding wouldn't come cheap. If she skimped and hired some musclehead meat-wall, she might as well throw her money down a garbage chute.

"No food!" said the voice. "Don't be ridiculous. You need your strength."

Ahsoka shook her head. She'd already spent a good deal of money on fuel, and eaten her way through a lot of the rest of it. She just got so hungry sometimes. She was aware the voice was messing with her head, and scared that it was getting better at it. The first few times she'd binged, she'd eaten until she was close to vomiting -- now, instead of leaving her feeling bad, the hunger tapered off when she was pleasantly stuffed, and her system flooded with soothing endorphins. Food was becoming a dangerously seductive drug.

The smell of rich, meaty dianoga pie fresh out of the over hit her like a Force push as she walked through the cafe door, covering the smell of the air and, mercifully, the cafe's other patrons. Her mouth flooded with drool at the thought of sinking her teeth into the flaky crust. "Just a slice won't hurt -- bounty hunters don't cost that much."

Ahsoka shook her head. That wasn't her! It was the voice! And it only went to show exactly how much she needed to find another Jedi -- someone who could guide her, who could help her face up to this mental intruder.

She scanned the section of the room where the bounty hunters discreetly plied their trade. She sensed little enough skill from most of the current crop -- the aforementioned meatheads were plentiful -- but from two possibilities, she felt something more. Something stronger. At one of the tables, a pair of fierce-looking Wookiees sat, nursing mugs of krayt milk and snacking on a basket of wookie-ookies. And at the bar, she spotted a slender -- relatively, of course -- young Hutt surrounded by a bevy of chubby Twi'lek girls. Making sure her hood was drawn low over her face, Ahsoka took a deep breath and approached --
111111222111.title: To the Smuggler's Moon

choices: The Wookie Hunters stalk the planetside
Ahsoka's hunger gets the best of her
1111112221111.content:
Though the race of gigantic wooly monsters had been widely relegated to the role of slave properties in Galatic affairs, the truth was that Wookies were amongst the most fearsome bounty hunters in the Galaxy. Tenacious, natural born hunters with instincts and skills honed by the coming of age ritual known as the hrrtayyk ceremony, all Wookies had natural aptitude towards hunting and survival. Ashoka knew that if anyone could track a Jedi through the city, it would have to be them.

"Why do you approach us." the Wookie howled. "Turn around. Walk away." the other Wookiee replied in kind.

"Please." Ahsoka gulped. "I have need of your services. I can"

"We have nothing to offer one such as you. Soft. Weak. You are fit only to feed a starving Bolotaur." the Wookie growled, looking back to his drink and ignoring the young Torguta."Turn around. Walk away." added the Wookiee once more.

Ahsoka backed away slowly. It didn't seem like she was going to get anywhere here. The voice in her head chimed in. "Why do you allow others to push you? Your master, the council, these beasts.You could tear them limb from limb, the Jedi may be incompetent and corrupt, but you are a skilled Warrior. They are animals, use their skills like the loathesome beasts they are. Instill fear in them, use their skills."

"You're right." Ahsoka thought to herself, the confidence instilled in her once more. With the outstretch of her hand, the wookie was sent hurtling into the wall, caught off guard by the unassumed power of the young girl. The patrons of the cafe did not look away from their tables, all to use to the hourly brawl to pay it much attention. The remaining Wookie, shot to his feet, pulling out his bowcaster and began to take aim. Effortlessly, Ahsoka pulled into the force, ripping the Bowcaster from the Wookie's grip and into her own. She leveled it at his head. "I offered you credits for your service. You will take them."

"A force adept. The price on your kinds head is high." said the Wookie as he sat back down, taking a sip from his mug. His brother brushed himself off the floor and did likewise. "We do not seek profit. It is for the hunt."

"Give us an interesting target. It will be considered. Your respect has been earned. You were not what we expect."

"I am looking for remaining members of the Jedi Order." Ahsoka said as she unclenched in relief. The whole intimidating act was more exhausting than she thought. Or maybe her blooming belly was just weighing her down. "I believe that anyone who survived might be lying low on this planet"

"Jedi." the Wookiee growled. "I have smelled their stench on this planet." His brother chimed in. "They are good game, a target worthy of being stalked."

"We accept." they both added.

"You are learning." the voice said approvingly. "Would you not say you have earned a reward? Those credits must be burning a hole in your pocket. That dianoga pie smells good does it?"

"Well...maybe just a slice or two..." Ahsoka thought to herself as she called the attention of the waiter.
1111112221111.title: -- the Wookies.

choices: Eat some or all of the prepared meal in the box.
Ask the holocron more questions. It's time for answers!
11111122211112.content:
"1 please," Ashoka told the waiter, unbeknownst to her the holocron's voice in her head tricked her into ordering 1 Whole pie instead of a slice. It was also of the largest size. As big as her head, "What The?" Ahsoka thought to herself, "That is your dessert," the voice told Ahsoka.

The waiter gave Ahsoka the rest of her meal, as he did so her jaw stayed dropped the whole time. It was lucky for her she was wearing a cloak and the waiter couldn't see it. The appitizer was a cream of Fleek Eel half the length of her arm, a thick Besh-Leth-Trill sandwich for the main course, a small yet large for Ahsoka sized bowl/pot of Creamed Rishi Corn soup for a side dish and a pitcher of Krayt Milk for a drink.

Ahsolka was also lucky in the light that the other patrons paid no attention as they cared only for themselves. Such is all too common in an atmosphere of a place like Nar Shaddaa.

All too shocked at the immencity of her meal Ahsoka began to argue with the voice in her head, "I can't eat all this! I'd explode!". The voice responded in kind with it's usual calming demeener, "Pace yourself then if you can't all at once but you simply must eat to obtain more power from the force."

Ahsoka ignored the voice signing it off as rubbish, and began to think of the problem in front of her she then notifced that her waiter was a Dug, and he asked her, "Is this for here or to go?" Ahsoka rememberd how mean dugs can be from the story Anakin told her about how used to pod race against 1 named Sebulba. Ahsoka quickly chose to leave, "To go." she told him. The dug waiter then insulted her in the manner standard to his species, "That will be 4 Truguts Hutt-Face poodoo."

This obviously made Ahsoka angry. Despite the common knowlege she and everyone else in the bar/diner knew that dugs are the rudest species in the galaxy, that they insult everyone even each other, and that they couldn't be nice to save their own skins.

Ahsoka knew that punching a patron or 2 was tollerable in these slums but to kill a waiter would only cause her more troble then she needed.

The bigger problem was that she didn't have enough credits to pay the amount he demanded. "Why don't you just use Mind Trick on him?" the voice asked, "I don't know how to use that force power." Ahsoka yelled with her mind at the voice.

After a breif demonstration by forcibly taking control of her hand Ahsoka as a breif puppet of the voice then used mind trick on the Dug. He then took the remants of her money and put her meal in a metal box.

It was small enough for Ahsoka to be able to carry it by herself, unfortunatly it was also too big for her to hide it under her cloak.

She then left the diner/bar and kept walking away from it for some time until she could see it no more behind her.

She then came upon a ledge to sit on, and did so. With the box next to her and various land speeders whizzing by almost too fast to see far below, Ahsoka took out the triangular pyramid of the Lisal holocron from her pocket. And asked it a question about a detail she didn't realize about until now.

"Why did you keep calling me Darth Phega?" The voice then revealed it's answer as it shined from the dark transparent red glass,"That was the sith who built me. When you picked me up I assumed you were her."

Ahsoka then began to think about what to do next before she should find herself a suitable lair on Nar Shaddaa...
11111122211112.title: Ahsoka's hunger gets the best of her

choices: The bounty hunters have located a possible fugitive Jedi.
Ahsoka finds a temporary place to stay and a source of income.
111111222111121.content:
Ahsoka wanted to ask the holocron more questions -- knew she should -- but the tight tendrils of hungers were wrapping themselves around her stomach once again. "You're doing this, aren't you?" she said, irritated. "Nice try, but you won't distract me that easily--"

Abruptly, a blinding sheet of hunger slapped her in the face, almost doubling her over. Gahh! Clutching her stomach, which felt like it was devouring itself, with one hand, she gripped the handle of the box and dragged it into a secluded alley, the metal corners screeching against the material of the walkway. She practically ripped the cover off, and began stuffing food in her mouth. I just need something in my stomach -- just something -- so I can think straight!

Satisfying her hunger was like trying to fill a Sarlacc with an eyedropper, but she eventually made headway. After half the sandwich, all the soup, and a good part of the milk, she was cogent enough to berate herself for being stupid enough to back into an alley in this rathole without first checking it for nasty surprises. She really shouldn't have scraped the box against the walkway, either; if it had made a mark, it would have been like an arrow pointing right too her. Fortunately, the Vertical City was built for rough treatment.

Ahsoka reduced everything but about half the pie to a mess of scraps before she was too full to eat any more.

"Okay, you. Let's talk. And don't even think about making me hungry again, because the cargo hold is full up!"

"Yes ... you have done well. You have indulged yourself to repletion," the voice said, "and your power will grow as you do."

Ahsoka frowned. She'd made another misstep, she realized with annoyance. She hadn't meant to gorge herself again. That had been practically a week's worth of food!

"I don't want power at that cost!" she snapped. "Not if it comes from the Dark Side!" And not if it's going to make me fat, she added mentally.

"As you wish," the voice whispered. Then the holocron went silent.

"Wait, hey! We're not done here!" Ahsoka hissed, shaking the little device. Damn it!

She was unable to get any response. Groaning as her muscles flexed around her tightly packed stomach, she stood up. Her body felt sluggish and overstuffed, but her connection to the Force did feel ... stronger. More responsive. She positioned her hand over the metal box and it flew up into her hand with barely a thought. Easy as -- ugh -- pie.

Perhaps she should embrace this power -- just for now. Just until she could track down another Jedi. She needed help. The thought of what these binges were going to do to her body if they continued... no! The quicker she found someone else, the better. Even if she had to use powers tainted by the Dark Side.

Feeling grateful for the concealing cloak which hid her distended middle, she left the alley and resumed her search.
111111222111121.title: Box Lunch

choices: "A strange old woman who rants constantly about the Force" (Vima-Da-Boda)
"An older gentlemen surrounded by armed bodyguards" (Rahm Kota)
1111112221111211.content: On her way back to the cantina, Ahsoka found herself confronted by the Wookiee bounty hunters she met earlier. Much to her delight, they did not seem to notice her distended belly, and better yet, they claimed to have found a lead as to the location of a possible Jedi. "The target is on the other side of the city," growled their leader, an unpleasant, flat-topped Wookiee named Snoova. "Reports indicate that the target is..."
1111112221111211.title: A Jedi is found!  But who?

choices: Eventually, the Wookiees return, annoyed that she found the Jedi without them.
The bartender snitched; every thug in the bar pulls their blasters on Ahsoka!
11111122211112111.content:
"The target is an elderly human woman living somewhere in the slums," said Snoova, looking carefully at his data pad. "Reports indicate that she was last spotted at the Orange Lady tavern here in the Corellian Sector. Intel about her appearance and abilities is lacking, but I'm confident that you'll be able to help us sniff her out, Master Jedi". As he growled out that last remark, he briefly glared in Ahsoka's direction before turning to face the other Wookiee again. "We move now; if we wait, our quarry is likely to escape!" At that, the two gathered up their gear and headed off toward the nearby speeder park, while the younger brother at the rear of the pack motioned for Ahsoka to follow.

They all piled into large, scuffed up-looking airspeeder and began flying toward the target area. The young Jedi tried to keep her mind off of her burgeoning hunger by watching the many glowing skyscrapers as they flew past them, but soon enough, the malevolent voice in her head began to speak to her once more. "So, it looks like you're getting closer to your goal," it said to her, sounding as smooth and seductive as ever. "But what will you do when you find this lost Jedi? Surely, even together, you wouldn't be able to stop the Empire...no, you would require far greater power for that..."

'I'm still not listening to you,' the former Padawan thought in response, though she herself was having a hard time believing it. Even though she had just stuffed herself practically to bursting, she could feel a powerful hunger gnawing at her once more. "Oh, that's just not fair..." she moaned plaintively; luckily for her, the sounds of the city drowned out her voice. 'Just a little further...'

----

About half of a standard hour later, the trio arrived at the Orange Lady. Shouldering his bowcaster, Snoova turned to Ahsoka and barked, "Follow our lead, child. We do not wish to be conspicuous. Just keep to the rear and tell us when you sense the Jedi, understood?" The Togruta nodded silently, her mind still fixated on the holocron's voice and the growing empty feeling in her belly. They soon entered the cantina, and Ahsoka tried her best to focus her Force senses to find the Jedi hiding within. It was difficult to sort out any individual signatures from the melange of life forms present in the bar, and her growling gut didn't make things any easier.

"Anything yet?" asked the younger Wookiee. Ahsoka simply shook her head. "Ugh...okay, let's try splitting up. Brother and I will search the front, you check out the back. But don't look like you're checking the place out! Just...walk casual, okay?" The former Padawan giggled slightly at how nervous the seemingly-fierce Wookiee had become now that he was on the job, before proceeding toward the rear of the room and walking up to the bar.

"What can I gets youse?" replied a voice from behind it. A surly-looking Chiss bartender rose from behind the counter, focusing his fluorescent, red eyes on Ahsoka.

"Uh...Ruby Bliel, I guess..." she said, scratching the back of her head nervously. Ahsoka had never really been into alcohol, no doubt due to the stodgy attitudes of the Jedi Order. Truth be told, she didn't even want the drink; no, right now, she was far more interested in ordering another extravagant meal for herself. But to do that would be to appease that wretched voice from within the Holocron-- Ahsoka hoped that a drink would fill her stomach somewhat and make her feel less hungry.

"Hm...you seems a bits young to be drinkings, little ladies".

"Is your job to serve drinks, or to ask questions?"

"...Good points". At that, the bartender turned and grabbed the ingredients for Ahsoka's drink. As he worked behind the counter, Ahsoka leaned against the bar and spoke again.

"So...you think you might be willing to help me with something," she asked, trying to sound casual. He paused to look back at her, still busily mixing drinks.

"Hm...depends on exactly whats you needs helps with..." he replied cryptically, shooting her a smug grin. Ahsoka was in no mood for games, though, and proceeded to pull out of one of her lightsabres and slam it down on the bar in front of him. "Oh!" he exclaimed, stepping back a bit. "Jedis...that's, uh, different. I'd be happies to helps!" He placed her drink on the counter, carefully staying clear of her sabre.

"I'm no Jedi, got it? I'm just a girl who's looking for one..." The young Togruta maintained her intimidating facade, though she couldn't help but wince for a second as she took a sip from her bitter drink. "You know anyone around here who might fit the bill?" At this, this bartender looked around nervously, shaking a bit as he pointed one blue finger toward a table in the back corner of the bar. A hunched figure in a black, hooded cloak sat at alone the table, their face concealed in shadow.

"I'm not sure...but peoples, they talk about the ones in the back there. They say she carries a laser swords, like yours, and that she knows all kinds of old Jedis stories...but you didn't hear it from mes, understand?" Ahsoka turned her Force senses toward the old woman in the corner, and while her signature was weak, it was indeed stronger than anyone else's in the bar. She smiled, before grabbing her drink and standing up.

"That should be enough...thanks a lot for the 'drinkses', stranger," she said confidently, striding over to the corner while the nervous bartender knelt behind the counter and began fiddling with some buttons...meanwhile, Ahsoka had already sat down at the would-be Jedi's table. Before she could say anything, though, the old woman spoke to her.

"Vima knows why you have come, youngling..." she uttered in a weak, croaking voice. She raised her head to face Ahsoka, and the Padawan had to stop herself from screaming upon seeing her hideously wrinkled and scarred face; the woman looked to her more like a freshly-exhumed corpse than a living Human. "She senses the dark power emanating from that Holocron you possess...Vima may be old, and her connection to the Force weak, but she knows the Dark Side when she feels it!"

"Y-You...you know about the Holocron?" Ahsoka replied breathlessly, briefly clutching her stomach as another painful wave of hunger washed over her-- the Dark Side presence that had taken up residence in her mind was clearly reacting to the presence of another Jedi. "Then you must know how to help me! Quick, come with me; let's get out of this dump and find a safe place to--"

"Hold on! Were you not listening? Vima no longer feels the Force as strongly as she once did, and she would be helpless if someone found us...please, relax for now. Sit and tell Vima of your troubles." Not having any better ideas, Ahsoka sidled up closer to the ancient Jedi and began explaining what had happened since she acquired the Sith Holocon from Lisal. All the while, the voice continued taunting her from within her mind.

"Hmph...you think this wizened old fool can help you, Darth Phage? (A/N: Hope you don't mind I messed with the spelling a bit; I thought this variant helped highlight the pun a bit better) Or, rather, Ahsoka...not that it matters much what I call you. You'll succumb soon enough either way...your hunger for power will be all-consuming..."
11111122211112111.title: Someone else who knows about the Holocron?

choices: They hole up in the old woman's hidey-hole.
They attempt to leave the planet.
111111222111121112.content:
"Hush up, you," Ahsoka told the voice, slurping down more of the Ruby Biel. Her face twisted around the bitter taste. She forced herself to take another gulp; anything to numb the gurgling knot of hunger and compulsion inside her.

"Careful, youngling. It is stronger than it tastes."

"It tastes strong enough to knock the teeth out of a rancor," Ahsoka muttered, making another face. "Listen, I've been looking for another... for someone like you for a while. I think we can help each other out."

"And just how is it you think I can help you?" the old woman asked.

Ahsoka kept her voice low. "There's a certain man who wants us dead, a man who it would be in everyone's best interests to stop. I can't do it alone, and -- and I can't do it without guidance, training -- "

She stopped talking suddenly, realizing that the room had gotten strangely quiet. Dozens of pairs of eyes were on her; a scores of hands, claws and tentacles reached for blasters.

She had a very bad feeling about this.

"Down!" she said, pushing the old woman under the table with one hand and drawing her lightsaber with the other. With practiced ease she deflected the first few shots. A Rodian in the corner slid to the ground, brought down with his own pistol. Ahsoka's head swam from the sudden movement. Damn drink!

The bounty hunters seemed stunned by the turn of events. Most likely none of them had ever faced off against a Jedi before. Before they could recover, Ahsoka grabbed the old woman' arm and practically dragged her through the back door.

Her spirits fell. What she'd thought was a way out was just a back storeroom. But there, near the ceiling - a tiny window. An escape route!

Why run? said the voice. It would be so easy to stay and cut them down.

"That's horrible -- and it would draw even more attention to us, anyway," Ahsoka snapped, pushing the old woman through the window. The scrawny bag of bones went through easily, and Ahsoka lifted herself to the sill.

Her head had always been the part of her hardest to get into a small space -- humans had always laughed at her for that. Them and their infinity smushable "hair" -- why couldn't they understand that a growing girl's lekku needed room to, well, grow? With a grunt, she forced her head through, and hauled herself to freedom--

Or so she thought. Halfway through the window, she ground to a halt at the sill slammed into the top of the round cushion of pudge sticking out from her middle. Helplessly, she pushed against the wall with her hands.

Arrgh, she moaned to herself, I can't be this fat! Can I?

She sucked in her stomach as far as she could and managed to scrape through the window, heart momentarily leaping with elation, only to find herself wedged even tighter as her rear ear bumped into the opening. No matter how she twisted and turned, it was too big to pass through. She was caught.

Please don't let it end like this! she begged in her mind. Death was bad enough. But to die because her butt was the size of Alderaan? It was humiliating!

"Calm down, youngling," the old lady said from beneath her. "Think about what you're doing!"

Ahsoka shook her head, trying to clear out the fear and hate and find a calm, cool center. At least she could die with dignity, holding her lightsaber high and proud--

That's it, she realized suddenly. She whipped the blade around her in a well-practiced, well-trained circle, a shape she'd drawn with the blade of light so many times she could do it with her eyes closed. A circle of wall slipped easily away from the main body, and in moments Ahsoka had popped herself out. She was still stuck in the window -- but the window was no longer stuck in the wall.

"Thanks! Now move," Ahsoka barked, "before they follow us back here!" And two Jedi fled into the glittering lights of the Nar Shaddaa night.
111111222111121112.title: Greedo Shoots First Through Twentieth

1111112221112.content:
Ahsoka carefully approached the Hutt. She knew that Hutts in these parts were generally well connected, and maybe one of the chubby Twi'lek girls she saw was a bounty hunter for hire. She walked up to the Hutt. 2 Twi'leks, one red and blue. These two were well endowed in both the front and the back, and looked to weight about 180 standard pounds. "Halt." they said simultaneously.

The Hutt looked at her and said, "Why do you approach Jaweken the Hutt?"

Ahsoka looked at the Hutt and said, "I would like to hire a bounty hunter."

The Hutt licked its lips greedily. :Would you, now?" It hissed, in surprisingly good Galactic Common. "It will cost you 10,000 credits. Can you pay that?" It said, staring at her intently.

Ahsoka, in her mind, sobbed. She could barely afford a tenth of that. Suddenly, the voice in her head spoke up, "Use the Jedi Mind Trick." it stated simply.

"I never learned that power!" wailed Ahsoka in a mental roar.

The voice replied, "I will teach it to you, but only if you pick the bounty hunter of my desire."

Ahsoka sighed. "Deal." she agreed.

Suddenly, her body was not her own. The knowledge of how to control a person's mind and how to bend it to your will implemented itself as she watched the voice control her body for her. "You have no need for my money." said the voice-controlled Ahsoka. "You will give me a bounty hunter free of charge." It continued, waving its hand in front of the Hutt.

"Very well." the Hutt rumbled. "Which is to your liking?"

The voice picks the fattest of the assembled Twi'leks, which was...

A.) Layla, a blue Twi'lek that weighed about 190 pounds. She had a pretty hourglass figure, with both large breasts and large boobs, but a small stomach.

B.) Shindala, a red Twi'lek that was 260 pounds and absolutely obese. Had weight evenly distributed everywhere.
1111112221112.title: -- the Hutt.

choices: Establish a base, then speak to the voice.
Speak to the voice, then establish a base.
11111122211121.content:
"I want that one." the voice-controlled Ahsoka said, pointing at a plump blue Twi'lek.

The Hutt licked its lips. "Very well." it said. "Oh, and I forgot to mention: This Twi'lek is yours to keep. I sell my bounty hunters, rather then loan them out. She's your problem now." The Hutt then burst into a low laugh, and pressed a small button next to it. It's small throne retreated into the recess of the wall, the Twi'leks following him, leaving Ahsoka all alone with the Twi'lek.

The Twi'lek smiled shyly at her. "Hello. My name's Layla." she said. "I'm actually surprised you picked me, due to my... weight issues." she said.

Ahsoka smiled in return. "My name's Ahsoka. I hired you because I need your help... do you think you can find a Jedi?"

A weird smile crossed Layla's face. "Let's discuss it over lunch." she said.

"Alright." grinned Ahsoka, pleased to have made a new friend.

The pair sat down at the bar. The waiter, a dark haired human, walked up. "Can I take your order?" he asked.

Ahsoka opened her mouth to speak, but the voice actually stopped her from speaking. The voice had picked Layla because the voice could manipulate Layla into getting Ahsoka to eat more. Layla told the waiter, "2 whole dianoga pies and 2 Red Spritzers." The waiter nodded, and retreated to prepare their order.

Ahsoka opened her mouth to protest, but was suddenly hit by a wave of exhaustion. She could barely move, let alone speak. "Why am I... so... tired..." she thought to herself. The voice answered, "That is the price of my powers, Ahsoka. I can teach you all of my secrets, but if you don't eat, it will strain your body." Ahsoka was about to respond, but the voice cut her off. "Finish this meal and send the bounty hunter off on her mission. Then all shall be explained."

Ahsoka was so tired, but managed to lift her head and take a bite of the pie that had been placed in front of her. Both her and Layla were totally silent, consuming their respective meals. As Ahsoka ate more and more, and her stomach bloated out, she finally started regaining energy. She took a sip of the drink, Red Spritzer, she had heard it called, and was hooked. She chugged 2 or 3 and finished her pie, her stomach bloating into a small paunch that rested on her lap. Finally, her and Layla both finished. "So, you want me to find a Jedi, yes?" asked Layla. "No problem." she said, picking her teeth. "But you have to tell me why." she finished.

Ahsoka looked at her. "I am a Jedi padawan, and I need to finish my training." she said bluntly. "But at the same time, I also want to build a strike team to get rid of Vader." she continued. "You happen to be the first member."

Layla smiled. "Sounds interesting. Very well, I'll find you a Jedi. But it might take a while, so here's a com link. Establish a base for us and I'll meet you there." Layla then slid off of her bar stool and walked towards the door.

Ahsoka, full to the bursting, decides to...
11111122211121.title: Layla

choices: A spare room in a place of your choice (casino, buffet, shipyard, etc.)
111111222111212.content:
"Voice? Voice? Can you explain now?" Ahsoka asked, reaching out in her mind.

The voice replied, "Of course, Darth Phe- Ahsoka. What do you wish to know?" it asked.

"Well, first of all, what is your name?" asked Ahsoka.

The voice replied, "My name is Pirasmos."

Ahsoka then asked a flurry of questions that were bothering her: "What is your purpose? How were you created? How was Lisal destroyed? Can you teach me about the Force? Why am I so hungry?"

The voice chuckled. "Easy, Ahsoka. I will answer your questions in order. My purpose was to remain on Lisal and teach the first Force Sensitive that stumbled across me the ways of the Force. I was created by the sacrifice of 100 obese females of a variety of species. Lisal was turned into a wasteland by the person that created me, Darth Phegia. Since I assumed you would follow in her footsteps, I deemed you the same. She destroyed it by using gluttony, the ultimate Sith power. You see, the more fat your body contains, the more Midiclorians it can contain, allowing for more Force power and greater control. Eventually, Darth Phegia became so powerful that she wanted to build a monument that would last forever. She used the greatest Force Power of them all, Force Consume. It channeled all of the life on Lisal into Darth Phegia. However, Darth Phegia wasn't as powerful as she believed, and the excess energy destroyed her, leaving Lisal a lifeless wasteland for the rest of eternity. As for teaching you the Force, I can do that, but only if you indulge yourself. You don't have to stuff yourself to the brim, but make sure you are full at meal times. As for why you are so hungry, I cannot say." finished the Voice, then it went silent.

Ahsoka took in this new information and nodded. Everything sounded right. But gluttony being the ultimate form of Sith? Maybe she should try a Jedi version, and use that to defeat Anakin. Now to find a base...
111111222111212.title: Speak to the voice, then establish a base.

1111112221112121.content:
Ahsoka stood up heavily, cradling her protruding stomach. She was very bloated, and was feeling sluggish. However, for whatever reason, she felt that her connection to the Force was stronger then ever, just as Pirasmos had said. Ahsoka had just begun waddling towards the door, to avoid upsetting her stomach, when the waiter approached her, saying, "Ma'am! You forgot to pay your bill!"

Ahsoka nodded, and reached towards her credits bag. "Alright." she said. "How much was it?" she asked.

"Well," the waiter began, "The cost for 4 dianoga pies, 8 Red Spritzers, and a Party Package, costs 1500 credits." he said.

Ahsoka looked at him. "Well, first off, I only purchased 2 dianoga pies, and what the heck is a Party Package?" she said, disputing her bill.

"Well, your friend, the Twi'lek, ordered 2 pies to go, and a Party Package is a 1250 credit special that includes unlimited food, drink, and the use of one of our more talented... dancers." he said sheepishly.

"I never ordered a party pack!" Ahsoka exclaimed.

"The men in the corner said you were paying for theirs." said the waiter.

Ahsoka looked to the corner. 5 thugs sat their, waving and grinning. Ahsoka glanced back at the waiter, ready to pay the bill, when Pirasmos exclaimed, "Use Mind Trick! Don't pay for those fools' meals! Then go and teach them some manners!"

Ahsoka silently agreeing, mustered all of the knowledge Pirasmos had given her, and spoke, "We have no need to pay. Leave." and waved her hand.

The waiter bowed and repeated, "You have no need to pay. I shall leave." and walked back into the kitchen.

Ahsoka didn't realize that Pirasmos was slowly manipulating her into making dark sided decisions, and went into a rage. "Who do those men think they ARE, trying to make ME pay for THEIR food? I'll show them! I'll teach them some decent manners!" Ahsoka turned towards the men and quickly took in the sight: Three burly humans armed with vibroswords, an Aqualish with a blaster rifle, and a Twi'lek with a shock stick. Ahsoka called to the group, "Hey bantha brains, trying to get me to pay for your meals?"

One of the humans got up and replied, "Watch your mouth, little girl. You don't want to get hurt."

Ahsoka called again, "You schuttas! It's apparent you haven't gotten your asses whooped in a long time, allow me to provide."

With that stinging remark, the 3 men charged, and the Aqualish pulled out his blaster rifle and aimed at Ahsoka. Ahsoka got in tune with the Force and was about to push the men away when Pirasmos whispered, "You are bloated. This allows me to lend my assistance." Ahsoka was suddenly aware of Pirasmos teaching her a variety of skills. Ahsoka, stuffed from her meal, used one of the powers Pirasmos had just transferred to her and unleashed it: It was Force Lightning, and it sprayed from her hands through the 3 men, electrocuting them. Turning to the Aqualish marksmen, Ahsoka then used Force Pull, and plucked the rifle out of his hands. Ahsoka then used Force Throw to throw the Aqualish onto the Twi'lek's shock stick. Ahsoka then turned to the Twi'lek and took a step forward. the Twi'lek got up and ran. Ahsoka then turned around and walked out of the bar.

***

Ahsoka walked into a hotel. She had wandered Nar Shaddaa's Corellian sector for hours, but had found no suitable place to stay. Finally, she had decided to get a hotel room. Walking up to the main counter, she said, "Hello. Can I get a room, please?"

The woman, a busty human female, replied cheerily, "Of course, dear. Would you like a suite or a regular room? The suite comes with unlimited room service."

Ahsoka replied, "I guess the suite, would that work for 2 people?"

The woman answered, "Yes! In fact, it's recommended for 2 to 5 people. Is that it?" she asked.

"Um, yes." said Ahsoka.

"Alrighty then. 1000 credits."

"I can stay for free." Ahsoka said, waving her hand.

"You can stay for free." the woman repeated. "Here's your room key." she said, handing Ahsoka a card key.

Ahsoka took the card key, got into the lift, and took it to the 4th floor, where her room was. Going into her room, she sent Layla a com telling her where to go. Ahsoka, exhausted after her long day, laid on her bed and fell asleep. When she wakes up...
1111112221112121.title: A hotel

11111122211121211.content:
The moment Ahsoka drifted out of sleep, she had one thought on her mind: food. She had a ravenous pang of hunger shooting through her somehow-still-hungry stomach.

Obviously from that damned holocron, Ahsoka thought, but the idea was quickly displaced by an almost automatic reach for the room's wall-mounted comlink. She pressed a small button, calling the hotel's kitchen while simultaneously projecting the menu into the air.

"Hello, room service?" Ahsoka spoke into the comlink's speaker.

"Yes, this is room service. Whaddya want?" replied a gruff voice, most likely the chef.

"I'd like to order, hmm... twenty dianoga pies, five gallons of blue milk, three dozen nerfburgers, and eight boxes of hubba chips."

The rather shocked chef continued, "Whoa. Uh, okay. You're lucky we just got in a new food shipment. It'll be done within half an hour. What's your room number?"

After telling him the number, Ahsoka checked the scale in the bathroom, out of morbid curiosity. She regretted it almost instantly.

"215 imperial wight units?!" she gasped, then proceeded to check herself out in the mirror. The scale definitely didn't lie. Her stomach had grown into a rather large potbelly, accentuated by several small love handles. Her fat was spilling slightly over the top of her pants, and a quick turn revealed that her butt and thighs were quite a bit larger, at the verge of bursting out. To top it all off, her breasts seemed to have doubled in size, and the beginnings of a double-chin were noticeable. Then, Piramisos' voice seeped back into Ahsoka's mind.

Yes, perfect. You are on the way to acquiring the power to defeat Vader. Show no restraint! You are still a flea on a gundark. Weak. Powerless. Hungry...

Any thoughts that remained in Ahsoka's head concerning Piramisos or her new figure were quickly displaced by the ding from the door. She quickly answered it, stared as two carts were wheeled in, convinced the server it was "on the house" with a mind trick, then dug in. She ate, ate, and ate some more, shoving all the food she could see down her gullet. When she finally felt full, she had barely eaten a quarter of it. Suddenly, a strange feeling crept over her. A sudden warmth, almost... fattening. Ahsoka noticed her stomach deflating, but becoming flabbier. She actually felt herself rising up slightly as her ass expanded, along with several minor rips and snapping seams.

Here is my gift to you, Phegia. You are now free to consume once more, and you shall find that you are much more... voracious.

"For the last time, don't call me that- uungh!" Ahsoka said to her mind, before a rippling wave of hunger shot through her. Almost mechanically, she resumed shoveling food into her mouth, without hesitation, or even thought. During her binge, she failed to notice Layla creeping in the door.

"Ahsoka, I- uh..." she stammered, but Ahsoka was absorbed in the plethora of food around her, of which a bit over half remained. Suddenly, a voice echoed through Lalya's head.

Hush, child. Do not disturb her. Do you not wish her to grow more powerful?!

Layla, filled with fear and confusion, asked, "Who are you? And why are you in my brain?"

I am a... friend of Ahsoka's. She must grow more powerful in order for her to succeed.

"And why should I help her, exactly? What's there for me to gain from this?"

You have the potential to become powerful in the Force, child. Ahsoka might be able to train-

"Wait, so if eating increases one's Force connection..."
11111122211121211.title: "Hello, room service?"

Layla opened the door and entered the room. Seeing Ahsoka passed out on the bed, she reached out to wake her, when, "FOOL! LEAVE THE GIRL BE!!!" thundered Pirasmos directly into Layla's mind.

A confused look appeared on Layla's face. "Who the hell are you? And why the hell not?" she asked.

Pirasmos whispered seductively into Layla's mind, "I am a friend of Ahsoka's. And if you want to see her grow more powerful, follow my instructions exactly."

Layla still looked confused. "Why would I want Ahsoka stronger? How would that affect me?"

Pirasmos lowered her tone even further. "Because, young one, there is a sliver of the Force in you. If Ahsoka becomes more powerful, she might just be able to awaken you to the Force."

Layla looked shocked, but slowly a grin spread on her face. "What do you need me to do?" she asked.


***


30 minutes later, Layla had hooked a suction tube onto a bucket and put the other end in Ahsoka's mouth. Layla filled the bucket with an assortment of grease and lard that the hotel had leftover, and it was a simple matter to buy it from the hotel. Turning the suction tube on, the grease/lard combination worked its way into Ahsoka's awaiting stomach.

***

Ahsoka woke up and glanced up blearily to see Layla shaking her shoulder. "Ahsoka. I haven't found anything today."

Ahsoka sighed. "That's alright. We have a ton of time to find a Jedi and face Darth Vader." she said. Ahsoka attempted to get up- but couldn't. "The hell?" she exclaimed, and doubled her efforts. Looking at her stomach, she gasped. It was perfectly spherical and gurgled and churned with indigestion.

Layla chuckled. "Looks like someone ate more food after I left?" she teased/lied.

Ahsoka stammered, "B-b-b-but I didn't-"

Layla shushed her. "It's fine. No need to be ashamed. As you can see, I'm still a TON heavier then you. It's like comparing a womp rat to a bantha!" Layla and Ahsoka both giggled at that. The pair chatted and joked for about another hour before...

The voice that poured from the Holocron told Ahsoka, "A skilled bounty hunter would be bound to draw attention to us. Take the fat one."

"Good point." Ahsoka thought, so she told the hutt. "I'll take that one." While pointing to Shindala, The Hutt had an expression of delight on his ugly face and spoke to Ahsoka in huttese, "With pleasure!" He then used his tail to whack Shindala over to Ahsoka. Shindala fell over, got up, walked over to Ahsoka and bowed. As her way of saying, "Thank you."

"She's your problem now!" The hutt spoke with as much arrogance his would be able to convey, "Don't even bother returning her. She was the worst boutny Hunter I've ever had. The only reason I didn't kill her was because she was too valuable as a slave, she's your slave now."

Learning these details only made Ahsoka very mad, she clenched her fists and thought, "I wonder how long it would take to make a hutt starve to death?"

But the holocron's voice was wise enough to delay her vengence, "There will be plenty of time for that later. For now we must find shelter."

In agreement, Ahsoka merely turned around and escorted Shindala out of the cantina.

Though the streets of Nar Shaddaa were not any better, Ahsoka spent some time walking away from that place with Shindala close behind, after the voice asked her to sit down on the boxes in the back alley they were going through for she was burning too many calories for the voices liking. Ahsoka asked it, "Did you know she was a was a slave?"

"In addition to her being a bounty hunter?" the voice responded, "Does it matter? You could just free her if you have a problem being a slave owner. Besides you already freed her from an abusive hutt."

Ahsoka consented to yet another good point the holocron had to offer.

She sat down on the nearest small box and Shindala asked with confusion, "Why did you stop here master? Is this your... fortress?"

"I don't have a fortress. I'm a new arrival..." Ahsoka began to explain with what ever was left of her honesty. Before she could speak more, Shindala interupted her, "Then where is your ship?" Shindala asked as though eager to flee Nar Shaddaa.

Ahsoka told her the truth much to Shindala's dissapointment. "I sold it to be dismanteld to spare parts to a junk dealer. And don't call me Master!" she then pulled down her hood, revealed her face to Shindala, and told her, "I'm a Jedi on the run..."

35 minutes later...

After explaining to Shindala what she knew about how the republic had become the empire. And how and why she had come to purchase her.
Shinalda was now sitting down next to Ahsoka equally devestated by the news.

"So you didn't come to clense this retched place of corruption?" Shindala asked, unaware of the details Ahsoka left out of her story, namely the holocron and her discovery of it.

"No... I figured this place would make it too difficult for the empire find me." Ahsoka responded. Despite being 10 years older then Ahsoka, Shindala was not quite as smart as Ahsoka was. But that was only because of being raised a slave more then anything else. But at least the more time Shindala spent talking with Ahsoka the smarter Shindala got.

"I was on my back to Coruscant when I heard the news." Ahsoka lied, much to the holocron's approval. Despite that Ahsoka did not lie just so she could please it. Ahsoka then asked Shindala about her slave life. "How can a slave also be a bounty hunter?" she asked.

Shindala answered, "I was a slave first 1 day a drunk bounty hunter gave me his gun and I shot him and tried to escape, I obviously failed, they only reason they didn't gun me down was because my master Baccuda... that was the name of the hutt you bought me from... never really liked the bounty hunter I killed anyway. He made me a bounty hunter because he was impressed with my will to fight."

Ahsoka asked another question,"Why didn't you flee on your 1st job?"

Shindala answered with some fear on her face. "When ever I did go out as a bounty hunter made me wear this collar, he said it would explode if I left the planet or I didn't return to him when he wanted me back or if I didn't give him all the money I made from the job. I don't know why I wasn't wearing it when you bought me, or why he didn't give it to you."

"He was probably saving it for his next slave, maybe that other Twi'lek you were with?" Ahsoka asked.

"No that was Layla she was never a slave to begin with. She was always a bounty hunter." Shindala replied, the duo then heard their rotund bellies growl with hunger. Although Ahsoka's was the only one that knew she ate had eaten a big meal no more then 3 hours ago, she didn't want to reveal how the holocron made her begin to get fat. Let alone that she had one Ahsoka just went along with the act and asked. "Is that...?"

Shindala only looked down at her big red round belly poking out of her barely fitting black padded armor, and held as if she was pregnant, though they both knew she was not."I got that bad rep because as a slave girl I was always hungry we never are given enough to eat so whenever I had job I spent most of my time out on the jobs stealing food eating as much as I could until Baccuda began to lose patience, and I ate even more when I got the money. I never did spent all of it, I just stole whatever I spent so he wouldn't notice."

Shindala seems to be smart for a slave yet still not as much as the average for Twi'lek women of her age. Realizing that she inadvertantly struck a nerve, Ahsoka then revealed her own chubby red belly to Shindala, just to make her feel better, and told her with arrogance she even lied about how she got it, "Hey you're not alone. All I've been doing for the past few days is eating and hiding, not exactly good for a jedi's figure." she mocked herself as she patted her thick potbelly though only half the size of Shindala's it jiggled with flab all the same.

This made them both laugh in way that they both needed, Shindala because she never did before and Ahsoka because it was her 1st opprotunity to do so since her ordeal began.

They then spent a few minutes looking up at the stars and the undersides of speeders passing overhead, they then agreed to stay together as friends.

Shindala uncertain of what to with her newfound freedom asked, Ahsoka, "What should we do now?"

Ahsoka then decided to answer with...
11111122211122.title: Shindala

111111222111221.content:
As Ahsoka and Shindala exited the area (not before quickly returning for a feast meal, obviously), they wandered the streets of Nar Shaddaa for hours, when they saw something disturbing. It was a squad of clone troopers, fencing off a cantina, and the smell of blaster gas and burnt flesh singed the air. As they moved closer, the pudgy pair noticed medics rushing to the aid of troopers with what were definitely lightsaber wounds. And then, on a hover-stretcher, some clones were pushing out the laser-riddled corpse of an old woman, who could only be identified as such because her face was relatively intact. In her hand was a Jedi lightsaber. Ahsoka managed to notice a clone trooper had a scanner out, using records appropriated from the Jedi Temple. The device identified the charred body as Vima-da-Booda, but also picked up another Jedi's face in the crowd.

"Oh, no... RUN!" Ahsoka yelled, just managing to dodge a barrage of blaster fire. The duo ran through the alleyways, getting stuck on more than one occasion, and they took a 10-second break. When Shindala was too tired to take another step, Ahsoka just unlocked the nearest door with the Force, pulled her chubby compatriot inside, and locked the door behind her. After the silhouettes disappeared, the pair turned around, and they realized they were in paradise! It was an abandoned, but very large food storehouse; despite being mostly empty, there was enough food to feed a few hundred people for a month. Since the food was designed to last for months on a space freighter, all of it was perfectly edible! The duo had found a base, and they were going to use it to the fullest (until they were at their fullest)...
111111222111221.title: Finding a Hideout

The pair had spent the entirety of the past several days gorging themselves without limit, while the Holocron felt what would somewhat qualify as amusement, knowing that Ahsoka would fulfill its wishes. As Ahsoka woke up from another food coma, she was shocked at how big she had become. Her gargantuan, perfectly spherical belly, rather full, but layered with a thick coating of blubber, covered her enormous thighs entirely, protruding at least two feet. As she struggled to get up, she heard a riiip!, which was definitely her pants. As she turned around, she noticed her now-exposed rump had grown into two very massive balls of flab, right below a muffin top that looked like she was wearing a thick orange-red skirt of fat! her neck had disappeared between several chins, and her cheeks had become balls of blubber. And to top it all off, her breasts, now barely contained by her strained top, were almost as big as her head!

Shindala hadn't fared much better. Her potbelly had grown into several rolls of lard, flanked by a pile of thick love-handles. Her ass had grown almost as wide as she was tall, with thighs that rivaled her stomach in size. When Ahsoka looked at her bounty hunter, covered in food stains, stuffing her face, she felt... aroused. The Jedi made her way over, and they started talking. Then they started feeding each other. Then there was cuddling, with massive stomachs and rolls rubbing against each other. Just before things could get any more serious, their guts groaned loudly in unison. The doughy duo then started breaking open food containers, stuffing their faces with any food they could find. They were thinking, but with their stomachs the entire time. They had only one motivation: hunger. A primal urge that caused them to continually stuff their faces for a long time. Use the Force, you fool! Since you are this large, the Force shall be much stronger with you! Lock the doors to delay them, fix the food crates, and cloak yourselves to their minds! Ahsoka did all those things with rather surprising ease. As a group of workers poured in, mostly Duros and humans, people started loading up the food crates, with the obese Jedi picking up snippets of conversation like "it goes bad tomorrow" and "bring in the new stuff." After about an hour of work, the entire warehouse was packed with food crates, ripe for the picking. Ahsoka and Shindala were like kids in a candy store! The moment the last worker left, the two waddled through the just-wide-enough rows, until they found the mother of it all: a shipment of fresh pies and meats, filling two containers twice the size of clone gunships! Become bigger than you thought was possible. Also, your fat friend could be happy as can be. Once you conquer the galaxy, you could make her your personal slave... If she turned around, she might be able to accomplish the goal she had originally started out with, and avenge the Jedi Order. She was about to turn around, when she felt her massive stomach growl, knowing that there was food...

Since I liked you, yet also hated you, I-

*BUUUUUUUUUURP!* *Buuurp!* *urp* *belch* *burp*

It was easy, if you were created by a very powerful Sith lord. Buried deep inside your subconscious, I found something. A longing. A fetish. By the time you polish off the rest of that food in the container, you'll be the fattest Hutt in this galaxy! How about that?

*BUURP!* "Where Shindala? I need *uuuurp* to know," Ahsoka the Hutt thundered, her voice much deeper.

Oh, your friend? I've taken care of her...

It was easy, if you were created by a very powerful Sith lord. Buried deep inside your subconscious, I found something. A longing. A fetish. So, I decided that once you had enough Force energy, I could manipulate it to make you the biggest, fattest, laziest pig in this galaxy! How about that?

*Belch*

I figured.

Ahsoka and Shindala spent hours searching the streets and cantinas all while avioding clone troopers and hiding whenever they saw them.

"This is the 5th place bar in a row you've searched! Get something to eat already before you Collapse!" "Shut up!" she screamed in her mind at it.

And yet Ahsoka knew all too well of the power it would occasionally get over her and stuffer her ever ballooning belly even further to the gills. (Whilte that might be taken literally in the star wars galaxy Ahsoka's species the Togrutas do not have gills.)

She wondered how much longer she could keep it at bay before it would take over and make her eat almost to the point of bursting again.

But as the sun began to set and the darkness of night began to engulf the surface of Nar Shaddaa Ahsoka and Shindala hid in a narrow alley about 6 meters wide sandwiched between 2 giant buildings they couldn't see the tops of one brown on the left one blue on the right.

Shindala began to become anxious, "We don't have a roof over our heads and we have found nothing, furthermore..." she was about to say something when her stomach loudly growled with hunger, and as Shindala placed her hand on her fat belly as if she was pregnant she realized she needen't explain any further.

"Alright I'll call off the search for now we need to find some where to hole up for the night." Ahsoka is unaware of the day/night cycle for Nar Shaddaa but she did know that the streets of slums become exponentially more dangerous at night.

"The night on Nar Shaddaa lasts over 43 hours there's no way were going to be able to stay cramped inside a building without supplies." (yes that info is accurate look it up on the starwars wiki wookieepedia)

"But I don't have the money to stay at a hotel room." Ahsoka told Shindala which made them even more worried.

"You could just use mind trick like we did before." The voice of the Holocron spoke inside Ahsoka's mind, "That's only a temporary solution and too risky to overuse. It might get them to turn us into the empire when they catch on, besides some of the patrons just might be species that are immune to it." Ahsoka thought thinking it over to her side... for now...

"Where else can we go?" it asked rhetorically. This made Ahsoka get angry with it then she heard the sound of Shindala screaming and falling.

Assuming it can only mean a thug or worse clone troopers Ahsoka drew her Lightsaber but didn't deploy the blade she wanted to save it for after she found out what the trouble was.

She instead found an open exhaust port on the side of the alley that was beneath the brown building to the left. it was pitch black the port but it looked large enough for Ahsoka even with her bloated form to fit inside then she heared Shinala scream her name.

She then decieded to go inside and after standing back up (no easy feat with her bloated form she had to use the force to do so) and looking around certain that no one was watching she used the force again to pick up nearby debris (sheet metal trash the whole city was almost literally a garbage dump they were that dirty) large enough to cover it behind her after she went inside and heavy enough that it would take a vehicle the alley was too narrow for or a force user to remove it.

Ahsoka then deployed the blade of her light saber to use as a lantern as she does not know of any force powers that could do this. She found Shindala unhamed who then told her. "This place looks like some kind of basement."

"But to what?" Ahsoka asked Shindala was unfamiliar with the area they were in above. Luckily they were able to find a light switch and with that Ashoka holstered her Lightsaber and then asked Shinala to take out her blaster an old SE-14 pistol. (Yes she has one she stole it from a separatist droid that was a body guard her a techno union member former hutt master made a deal of a sort with when no one was looking she didn't use it to kill the hutt because she knew it wasn't strong enough. And the hutt took away her weapons after each job and gave her none when she was traded to Ahsoka. Who found out about it during their girl talk.)

The room was basically empty nothing but generators with broken pipes that were supposed to seal shut the exhaust port, but didn't they were cold to the touch and have not been used in along time the power must be coming from the occupied floors above. Ahsoka could hear the noises of animals coming from the other side of the only door in the 20 square meter room.

They opened the door and went in 1 at a time the scene that greeted them wasn't pretty they found 3 human skeletons lying on the ground the room was crowed with poisonous Morps (a pest animal from Degobah look it up) "Watch out!" the voice screamed at Ahsoka in her mind. One swung by and almost bit her face.

It didn't talk long for Ahsoka and Shindala to kill all 20 of them, Shinndala used her blaster as Ahsoka used force Lighting.

The room had everything 3 cots for beds a bathroom, a trash compacter and a Bonfire pit and it was huge of about 60 cubic meters in volume. But it was next to empty This was no squatter nest, this was a hideout! But how did these Morps get so far from their home world?

Ahsoka found a note on the door that lead out to the main building and read it out loud. "Your debt remains unpaid we warned you twice before there will not be a third you have 13 hours." The paper was old but no that old this happened somewhat recently the skeletons were stripped clean of meat but the morp must not have eaten in days. No wonder they were so aggressive, despite their meek fatness.

Shindala then saw the note "That emblem at the bottom belongs to the Hutt you bought me from! He killed these poor people." This made Ahsoka even more determined to kill that Hutt then she was before.

"That can wait till the... morning." the voice of the Holocron spoke to Ahsoka.

So Spent the next hour extracting the poision from the Morp with what they could find then they cooked them for a meal before bed...

Ahsoka, with the anger towards Anakin in her mind being eclipsed by the ravenous hunger in her stomach, staggered towards her starship's food stores. She brought up a small holographic display, asking her what food she would like it to dispense.

What to choose, what to choose... she pondered momentarily, moving her hand towards the 'energy bar' button. Suddenly, something clicked inside her mind, and Ahsoka's hand darted down the list towards 'Carbohydrate and Protein booster.' She furiously pressed the button multiple times, until the dispenser tray was full of vacuum-sealed bags of energy paste. Without thinking, Ahsoka took them, ripped off the tops, and shoveled them into her greedily waiting maw. They tasted like lard mixed with bread crumbs, and that was what it basically was. They also contained assorted digestion and metabolization aids, meant to give clone troopers in the heat of battle boosts of energy. However, due to the fact that Ahsoka was not of the same height, weight, build, or even the same species as the average clone trooper, there were some rather unintended side effects. Firstly, they were digested almost instantly, meaning that she now had approximately 10,000 extra calories in her system. Oddly enough, they manifested themselves mainly on her breasts, rump, and thighs. The next thing Ahsoka knew, it's that her clothes were all suddenly a lot tighter. After overcoming the shock, she stood in front of the reflective front of the food dispenser, checking herself out with a dirty smirk playing itself across her face. She shook her booty for a bit, and once the fact that she actually had a little jiggle wore off, Ahsoka decided to go and grab some more food.

As Ahsoka walked towards the ship's storage bay, she put an emphasis on swaying her now-wider hips, and occasionally slapping her butt just to feel the jiggle, reveling in how sexy she had become.

Maybe after they stop hunting the Jedi, I can become a stripper, maybe on Malastare, Nar Shaddaa, Courascant... As she mulled over the concepts of showing off her breasts for money, the velvety smooth voice returned to her head.

Yes, Darth Phegia, yes... you would be the most fabulous stripper, you could simply live the rest of your life in hedonism and debauchery... but don't you think that your assets are a bit, um, small? Ahsoka nodded her head, and found that she was at the door already. She slid it open, and stepped into the cold, climate-controlled air. She walked over to the nearest food container, pressed a few buttons, yanked off the lid, and indulged. More of those protein/carb energy boosts. She scarfed them down like she was possessed, and, by all accounts, she was. She stopped after several rips, stood up, and checked herself out.

Ahsoka's ass was probably twice as wide as before, with two nice, large cheeks the size of dinner plates, with orange flesh oozing out of the rips along the seams. These tapered down to well-padded thighs, oddly thick calves, and feet that had grown as a side effect of the chemicals in her choice snack, and were begging to burst out of her Jedi-issue boots. moving upwards, her ass rested on two voluptuous hips, a round, bulging gut that made her look seven months pregnant. Two large, round breasts, bursting out of a woefully inadequate top. her arms seemed a bit longer, and her shoulders seemed a bit broader, but Ahsoka didn't mind. Her neck seemed a bit thicker, but also longer. Her face seemed unchanged, except that her lekku seemed longer and fuller, the presence of a devilish glint in her eyes, and that her teeth looked a bit more like fangs. Overall, Ahsoka's skin seemed to be a bit redder than normal, and her body looked ridiculously hourglass-shaped.

Ahsoka, looking at her reflection with a devilish grin, started to do a dance that would make most professional strippers jealous. As she got lost in the rhythm, the motion, the feeling of her ass swinging like a giant club, the Holocron tried to communicate to her.

Phegia, are you not hungry? do you not wish to continue your binge, and grow more beautiful? I mean, you-

"Aw, shut up," Ahsoka moaned, before grabbing it and shoving it down into her rather large cleavage and resuming her dance. Then again, it did have a point. Ahsoka stopped. She looked at the food stores, and wondered if she could continue to indulge in the protein/carb boost slime, or should she try to consume the pretty large tank of lard in the corner?

Ahsoka came to in a small prison cell. Trying to move, she realized her arms were chained to the ceiling and her legs the floor, trapping her in place. Looking at her sides, she noticed how her lightsabers was missing

Ahsoka remembered how she ended up here. She'd had gone to answer a distress call from another Jedi, when she was ambushed by a masked individual and had been knocked unconscious in the ensuing fight.

"You're finally awake. Good, that means the fun is about to begin."

The speaker stepped out of the shadows but even if they hadn't Ahsoka would have recognized the voice in an instant.

"Ventress." Ahsoka glared harshly at the former Sith assassin.

"Skywalker's pet." Ventress said with a small smirk on her face.

"Why did you attack me? I thought you left the Separatists!" Ahsoka spoke, visibly confused. There had been reports of someone who fit Ventress' description living in the Outer Rim doing bounties. The Republic had heard of these reports, but were unable to do send anyone to investigate due to the War.

"You're not wrong." Ventress said behind gritted teeth, remembering how Dooku abandoned her. "I've left the Separatists but that doesn't mean I forgotten the all the pain you and your Master caused me, which is why I'm going to enjoy what's going to happen to you."

"If you're going to kill me, just do it know and get it over with." Ahsoka didn't want to die but she also didn't want to delay the inevitable. However Ventress's next words caught her off guard.

"Oh, but I'm not going to kill you. I just going to incapacitate you." Ventress stated with an evil look in her eye.

Before either of them could say anything else, the door to the cell opened and two guards came in.

"Is it ready yet?" Ventress asked the two new arrivals.

"Yes ma'am" one of them responded.

"Good. Then bring it." Ahsoka could practically hear the delight in Ventress voice making her even more nervous.

The guards nodded before leaving to bring in whatever Ventress had ordered them to.

"Well if you're not going to kill me what are you going to do to me?" Ahsoka asked, realizing she may not like the answer.

"Like I said, I'm not going to kill you just incapacitate you. There's a hutt lord living in the Outer Rim who loves fat girls."

Understanding what Ventress was saying, Ahsoka's stomach dropped but she allowed her to continue.

"He unfortunately lost one, when they tried to escape him. So he hired me to find a replacement and guess who the replacement is?"

"M-me?" Ahsoka asked dreading the answer.

"Correct." Ventress answered smugly. "So don't worry Ahsoka I'm not going to kill you, no. I'm going to fatten you up until you're only desire is to follow eat, and entertain my employer."

Ahsoka, not wanting to spend the rest of her life as a fat slave, began trying to use the force to escape her current predicament but to no avail.

"It's no use trying to use the Force to escape. Those metal cuts off the connection to the Force in your limbs. As long as they're on you, you can't use any force powers." Ventress remarked, crushing the Padawan's hopes of escaping.

At that moment, both ladies heard the sound of the door opening.

Instead, she was a sweaty, nearly naked, overweight shell of her former glory. Whenever Ahsoka wasn't being fed by the guards, escorted for a quick bathroom trip, weighed by FD-9 or taunted by Ventress, she was reflecting on the changes made to her body.

Her once flat stomach was a massive belly that looked like it belonged to a Hutt. Her now giant ass jiggled every time Ahsoka waddled around the huge fortress she was in. Despite being allowed breaks to go to the toilet while being escorted, she wasn't allowed any showers, leaving her to smell like a Hutt, as well as look like one.

Ventress also started visiting after each of Ahsoka's feeds just to gloat at Ahsoka. She would usually do this by taunting Ahsoka for thinking she was going to be rescued, calling her Assoka or showing off the Togruta's lightsabers which she'd taken from her when she captured her.

Ahsoka had just finished her most recent feeding, when FD-9 ordered her to be brought for her weigh in. She stepped on the scales and after a few seconds of waiting Ahsoka's new weight displayed itself.

"300 lbs" read the weighing scales.

"Excellent." said FD-9, sounding as close to happy as an emotionless machine could. "You will be transported to his excellencies' palace tomorrow. For now, you will return to your cell and rest. You have a lot happening tomorrow".

As he spoke the two guards began to lead Ahsoka back to her room, as she waddled along.

When they reached Ahsoka's cell, she was chained back into position by the guards. As they began to leave, Ahsoka noticed a bald, white-skinned assassin walk into the room.

"Hey Assoka!" Ventress mocked. "Aw, what's the matter? Did you finally realize how you're never going to be rescued?"

Ahsoka said nothing.

"Well you don't have to worry about that. After tomorrow, they'll never find you. Oh, but don't worry about your precious master. After you've been successfully delivered, I'm going to pay him a little visit."

Ventress then began to laugh maniacally, before leaving the Togruta Padawan alone with her thoughts.

Ahsoka, knew that tomorrow would be her only time for escape and so had come up with a plan on how to get free and escape. She hoped that it would work because she didn't want to be force-fed anymore (even though she slightly liked it, though she'd never outright state it).
